meanings.definition: A high-pitched sound made by a small animal or bird.
meanings.sent1: The wheep of the tiny bird filled the garden with its sweet melody.
meanings.sent2: I heard a soft wheep coming from the bushes, probably a squirrel.
meanings.sent3: The wheep of the mouse startled the cat, making it jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The wheep of the cricket in the night was like a tiny violin playing in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The wheep of the baby bird calling for its mother was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched sound, as a small animal or bird.
meanings.sent1: The kitten would wheep when it wanted attention from its owner.
meanings.sent2: The bird wheeped loudly to warn the others of the approaching danger.
meanings.sent3: The puppy would wheep playfully whenever it saw a new toy.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the branches wheep as it blew through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The child wheeped with joy as they rode the rollercoaster for the first time.

meanings.definition: A brief, high-pitched cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The wheep of the teapot signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent2: A sudden wheep from the distance caught our attention.
meanings.sent3: The wheep of the car brakes made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent4: The wheep of the whistle marked the end of the game.
meanings.sent5: The wheep of the alarm clock woke me up from my deep sleep.
